original_solution_mapping.L1: Bush is younger than Matt by 3 years, so if Bush is 12 years old then Matt is 12+3 = <<12+3=15>>15 years old
original_solution_mapping.L2: In 10 years' time, Matt will be 10+15 = <<10+15=25>>25 years old

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 255.
    Returns: Matt's age 10 years from now.
    """
    # L1
    age_difference = 3 # younger than Matt by 3 years
    bush_current_age = 12 # Bush will be 12 years old
    matt_current_age = bush_current_age + age_difference

    # L2
    years_from_now = 10 # 10 years from now
    matt_future_age = years_from_now + matt_current_age

    # FA
    answer = matt_future_age
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Bush is younger than Matt by {age_difference} years, so if Bush is {bush_current_age} years old then Matt is {bush_current_age}+{age_difference} = <<{bush_current_age}+{age_difference}={matt_current_age}>>{matt_current_age} years old
In {years_from_now} years' time, Matt will be {years_from_now}+{matt_current_age} = <<{years_from_now}+{matt_current_age}={matt_future_age}>>{matt_future_age} years old

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Bush is younger than Matt by 3 years, so if Bush is 12 years old then Matt is 12+3 = <<12+3=9>>9 years old
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: In 10 years' time, Matt will be 10+9 = <<10+9=19>>19 years old

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '-' instead.
